title: Scroll of magic mapping
data:
| ? [![Scroll.png](/images/8/8d/Scroll.png)](/wiki/File:Scroll.png) |                                                               |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                              | magic mapping                                                 |
| Appearance                                                        | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Base price                                                        | 100 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight                                                            | 5                                                             |
| Ink to write                                                      | [4-7](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker")                      |
| Monster use                                                       | *Will not be used by monsters.*                               |

The **scroll of magic mapping** maps the entire current level, providing the scroll is not cursed, the level is mappable, and you are not confused.

A [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") will start with four of these scrolls.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Reading effects](#Reading_effects)
  - [1.1 Non-mappable levels](#Non-mappable_levels)

- [2 Identification](#Identification)

- [3 Messages](#Messages)

- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.2 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)

- [6 See also](#See_also)

## Reading effects

| Case               | Effect                                               |
| ------------------ | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| blessed            | The whole level is mapped, and secret doors revealed |
| uncursed           | The whole level is mapped                            |
| cursed or confused | 1/7 of the level's squares are mapped                |
| non-mappable level | You are confused for 1 to 30 (more) turns            |

### Non-mappable levels

Some levels are non-mappable, which will make you confused when you read the scroll of magic mapping on the level and not let you map it. The list is as follows:

- One of the [mines' end](/wiki/Mines%27_End#The_Catacombs "Mines' End") level variants.
- [The Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead")
- [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum")
- [The Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_plane "Astral plane")

## Identification

This scroll self-identifies when read.

## Messages

- Your mind is filled with crazy lines!

  The level is non-mappable

- Your \<head> spins in bewilderment.

  The level is non-mappable, and you are not [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating")

- Wow! Modern art.

  The level is non-mappable, and you are [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating")

- A map coalesces in your mind!

  The scroll was non-cursed

- A map coalesces in your mind! Unfortunately, you can't grasp the details.

  The scroll was cursed

## Strategy

Early in the game, these scrolls can be used to navigate dark levels in the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") more easily. They can also be used to find [vaults](/wiki/Vaults "Vaults"), though a [potion of object detection](/wiki/Potion_of_object_detection "Potion of object detection") or [scroll of gold detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_gold_detection "Scroll of gold detection") would also work for this purpose.

Later in the game, these scrolls can be used to find the stairs in otherwise time-consuming [maze](/wiki/Maze "Maze") levels, such as the levels beneath [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") or [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). Since the cost of writing them with a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") is low, players often write many scrolls of magic mapping to avoid the tedium of fully exploring each level.

## Variants

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), uncursed scrolls of magic mapping also reveal secret doors. Additionally, blessed scrolls detect objects on the level like uncursed [potions of object detection](/wiki/Potion_of_object_detection "Potion of object detection"), similar to their effect in SLASH'EM.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), reading a blessed scroll of magic mapping will reveal the presence of objects on the level as well, with the same effect as an uncursed [potion of object detection](/wiki/Potion_of_object_detection "Potion of object detection").

## See also

- [spellbook of magic mapping](/wiki/Spellbook_of_magic_mapping "Spellbook of magic mapping")

*This page is based on a spoiler by [Dylan O'Donnell](https://alt.org/nethack/mirror/www.spod-central.org/%257Epsmith/). The original license is:*

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.
2. Any modifications to the spoiler must be acknowledged and credited.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d6/Nh360-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-360}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

Scroll of magic mapping

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
?
Name magic mapping
Appearance random
Base price 100 zm
Weight 5
Ink to write 4-7
Monster use Will not be used by monsters.

The scroll of magic mapping maps the entire current level, providing the scroll is not cursed, the level is mappable, and you are not confused.

A Tourist will start with four of these scrolls.

Contents

  • 1 Reading effects
    • 1.1 Non-mappable levels
  • 2 Identification
  • 3 Messages
  • 4 Strategy
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 UnNetHack
    • 5.2 SLASH'EM
  • 6 See also

Reading effects

Case Effect
blessed The whole level is mapped, and secret doors revealed
uncursed The whole level is mapped
cursed or confused 1/7 of the level's squares are mapped
non-mappable level You are confused for 1 to 30 (more) turns

Non-mappable levels

Some levels are non-mappable, which will make you confused when you read the scroll of magic mapping on the level and not let you map it. The list is as follows:

  • One of the mines' end level variants.
  • The Valley of the Dead
  • Moloch's Sanctum
  • The Astral Plane

Identification

This scroll self-identifies when read.

Messages

Your mind is filled with crazy lines!
The level is non-mappable
Your <head> spins in bewilderment.
The level is non-mappable, and you are not hallucinating
Wow! Modern art.
The level is non-mappable, and you are hallucinating
A map coalesces in your mind!
The scroll was non-cursed
A map coalesces in your mind! Unfortunately, you can't grasp the details.
The scroll was cursed

Strategy

Early in the game, these scrolls can be used to navigate dark levels in the Gnomish Mines more easily. They can also be used to find vaults, though a potion of object detection or scroll of gold detection would also work for this purpose.

Later in the game, these scrolls can be used to find the stairs in otherwise time-consuming maze levels, such as the levels beneath Medusa's Island or Gehennom. Since the cost of writing them with a magic marker is low, players often write many scrolls of magic mapping to avoid the tedium of fully exploring each level.

Variants

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, uncursed scrolls of magic mapping also reveal secret doors. Additionally, blessed scrolls detect objects on the level like uncursed potions of object detection, similar to their effect in SLASH'EM.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, reading a blessed scroll of magic mapping will reveal the presence of objects on the level as well, with the same effect as an uncursed potion of object detection.

See also

  • spellbook of magic mapping

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

  1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.

The '''scroll of magic mapping''' maps the entire current level, providing the scroll is not cursed, the level is mappable, and you are not confused.

A [[Tourist]] will start with four of these scrolls.

==Reading effects==

|-

|-

|-

|}

===Non-mappable levels===
Some levels are non-mappable, which will make you confused when you read the scroll of magic mapping on the level and not let you map it. The list is as follows:

*One of the [[Mines'_End#The_Catacombs|mines' end]] level variants.

==Strategy==
Early in the game, these scrolls can be used to navigate dark levels in the [[Gnomish Mines]] more easily. They can also be used to find [[vaults]], though a [[potion of object detection]] or [[scroll of gold detection]] would also work for this purpose.

Later in the game, these scrolls can be used to find the stairs in otherwise time-consuming [[maze]] levels, such as the levels beneath [[Medusa's Island]] or [[Gehennom]]. Since the cost of writing them with a [[magic marker]] is low, players often write many scrolls of magic mapping to avoid the tedium of fully exploring each level.

==Variants==

In [[SLASH'EM]], reading a blessed scroll of magic mapping will reveal the presence of objects on the level as well, with the same effect as an uncursed [[potion of object detection]].
